sn21.6:1.2: Then Venerable Bhaddiya the Dwarf went to see the Buddha.
sn21.6:1.3: The Buddha saw him coming off in the distance,
sn21.6:1.5: “Mendicants, do you you see this monk coming—ugly, unsightly, deformed, and despised by the mendicants?”
sn21.6:1.7: “That mendicant is very mighty and powerful. It’s not easy to find an attainment that he has not already attained.
sn21.6:1.8: And he has realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lives having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.”
sn21.6:1.9: That is what the Buddha said.
sn21.6:1.10: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn21.6:2.3: though their bodies are not equal,
sn21.6:3.2: if a little person is wise,
sn21.6:3.4: not the fool with a good body.”
